app.lem: Muspilli
app.rdg: Muspilli

app.lem: ...sin tac piqueme daz er touuan scal.
app.rdg: ...his day will come, when he shall die

app.lem: uuanta sàr sô sih diu sêla in den sind arhevit,
app.rdg: and immediately afterwards, when the soul is on its way

app.lem: enti si den lîhhamun likkan làzzit,
app.rdg: and leaves the body behind,

app.lem: sô quimit ein herí fona himilzungalon,
app.rdg: then an army/host comes from the heavens

app.lem: daz andar fona pehhe: dar pàgant siu umpi.
app.rdg: And another from hell: then they will fight for her [i. e. the soul].

app.lem: sorgen mac diu sèla unzi diu suona argêt,
app.rdg: The soul is anxious until the decision is made,

app.lem: za uuederemo lierje si gihalôl uuerde.
app.rdg: As to which host it is brought

app.lem: ipu sia daz Satanâzses kisindi kiuuinnit,
app.rdg: For if Satan’s servants win

app.lem: daz leitit sia sàr dar iru leid uuirdit,
app.rdg: They will lead her [the soul] to a place of pain,

app.lem: in fuir enti in instri dazi ist rehto virinlih ding.
app.rdg: Into fire and gloom: that is a truly horrible thing.

app.lem: upi sia kihalônt die die dar fona himile quemant,
app.rdg: But if she is taken by those who come from heaven

app.lem: enti si dero engilo eigan uuirdit,
app.rdg: and becomes a companion of the angels

app.lem: die pringent sia iif sàr in himilo rihhi:
app.rdg: They bring her up into the heavenly kingdom

app.lem: dâri ist lip àno tôd, Höht àno finstri,
app.rdg: Where there is life without death and light without darkness,

app.lem: selida àno sorgûn: dàr nist siuh neoman.
app.rdg: A home without worry, where no one is sick.

app.lem: denne in pardisu der man pu kiuuinnit,
app.rdg: When one has won a place in paradise,

app.lem: hûs in himile, dàr quimit imo hilfâ kinuok.
app.rdg: A house in heaven – there he will be given much help.

app.lem: pidiu ist dürft mihhil daz se pidenehanne
app.rdg: Thus the need is great for every man

app.lem: allero manno uuelihhemo, daz in es sin muot kispanc
app.rdg:
For his [spirit/heart]
the correct translation of “muot” controversial. A large camp of scholars translate it as “spirit” ( “der Geist” in modern German), although others translate it as "heart". to be moved,

app.lem: daz er kotes uuillun kerno tuoe
app.rdg: That he gladly does god’s will

app.lem: enti hellà fuir harto uuise,
app.rdg: And firmly avoids hellfire,

app.lem: pehhes pina: dàr piutit Satanâz
app.rdg: Hell’s pain: there the oldest Satan serves

app.lem: der altisto heizzan laue. sô mac huckan za diu
app.rdg: hot fire. Therefore he, who knows himself

app.lem: sorgen dràto, der sih suntîgen uueiz
app.rdg: to be sinful, shall think about this with great worry.

app.lem: uuë demo in vinstri seal sino virinà stûen,
app.rdg: Woe to him who shall atone for his sins in darkness

app.lem: prinnan in pehbe: daz ist rehto paluuic dink,
app.rdg: and burn in hell. It is a truly horrible thing,

app.lem: daz der man harét ze gote enti imo hilfa ni quimit
app.rdg: When one calls to God and receives no help.

app.lem: uuânit sih kinàdà diu uuênaga sèla,
app.rdg: The wretched soul hopes for mercy:

app.lem: ni ist in lu hue tin himiliskin gote:
app.rdg: But it is not remembered by the heavenly god,

app.lem: uuanta hiar in uueroltî after ni uuerkôta. –
app.rdg: Because it has not acted accordingly here in the world.

app.lem: Sô der mahtigo khuninc daz mahal kipannit,
app.rdg: When the powerful King orders judgement

app.lem: dara seal chunno queman to kilibhaz,
app.rdg: Every kin must come there,

app.lem: ni kitar parno nohhein den pan furisizzan,
app.rdg: no child will dare to reject the command

app.lem: ni allero manno kilih ze demo uiahale sculi;
app.rdg: there is no one among men who shall not go to this judgement.

app.lem: dàr scal er vora rihhe az rahhu stantan,
app.rdg:
There he shall give account to the Almighty
“rahha stantan” is a legal technical term meaning “to give an account for sth.”. The expression is still used in modern German as “Rechenschaft stehen”.

app.lem: pidaz er in uueroltî kiuuerkôt hapéta. -
app.rdg: for what he has done in this world.

app.lem: Daz hôrtih rahhôn dia uueroltrehtuuison,
app.rdg: I have heard the wise men of the world tell

app.lem: daz sculi der antichristo mil Èliase pagan.
app.rdg: That the antichrist shall fight against Elijah.

app.lem: der uuarc ist kiuuâfanit. uuirdit untar in uuic arhapan.
app.rdg: The fiend is armed, and then the fight between them will start.

app.lem: khenfun sint so kreftic diu kôsa ist sô mihhil.
app.rdg: The fighters are so powerful, the cause is so crucial

app.lem: Elias stritit pi den puiiigon lip:
app.rdg: Elijah fights for eternal life,

app.lem: uuili dên rehtkernôn daz lilihi kistarkan;
app.rdg: He wants to secure the kingdom for the righteous:

app.lem: pidiu scal imo helfan der himiles kiuualtit.
app.rdg: he who rules in heaven shall help him with this.

app.lem: der antichristo stêt pi demo altfiante,
app.rdg: The antichrist stands with the ancient foe,

app.lem: stêt pi Satanàse, der inan varsenkan scal:
app.rdg: Stands with Satan, who wants to destroy him [Elijah]:

app.lem: scal er in deru uuicsteti uuntèr pivallan
app.rdg: But he [the antichrist] will fall on the battlefield

app.lem: enti in demo sinde sigalôs uuerdan.
app.rdg: And in this way be without victory.

app.lem: doh uuànit des vilo uiäsero gotmanno
app.rdg: Yet many men of God believe

app.lem: daz der uuiho in demo uulge aruuartit uuerde.
app.rdg: That Elijah will be wounded in the battle.

app.lem: so daz Elíases pluot in erda kitriufit,
app.rdg: So when Elijah’s blood drips on the earth,

app.lem: so inprinnant die pergâ, poum ni kistentit
app.rdg: The mountains will catch fire and no tree will still stand,

app.lem: einic in erdu ahà sdr artruknênt,
app.rdg: Not a single one on the earth, all water dries up,

app.lem: muor varsuuilhit sih, suilizôt lougiu
app.rdg: The moor swallows itself, the heavens will burn slowly with flame,

app.lem: der himil, mano vallit, prinnit mittilagart,
app.rdg:
The moon falls, middle earth burns.
“mittilagart” could also be translated as “Midgard”, (although the phrase "middle earth" is now well known to readers of Tolkein) which was the name of the human realm in Norse and Germanic myth. It is an interesting example of the mixing of pagan cosmological models with Christian apocalyptic narrative.

app.lem: stèn ni kistentit denne stûatago in lant
app.rdg: Stones will not stand fast, then judgement day comes to the land,

app.lem: verit mit diu vuiru viriho uuisón,
app.rdg: Comes with fire to afflict the people:

app.lem: dâr ni mac mâc helfan vora démo muspille.
app.rdg: No kinsman can help another in the face of the Muspilli.

app.lem: denne daz preita uuasal allaz varprennit
app.rdg: Then over the whole width of the world, everything burns

app.lem: enti vuir enti luft iz allaz arfurpit,
app.rdg: And the fire and the air, everything is purified.

app.lem: uuàr ist diu marha, dar man mit sinèn màgon piec?
app.rdg: Where is then the homeland, for which one had fought before together with one’s kinsman?

app.lem: diu marha ist farprunnan, diu sèla stet piduungan,
app.rdg: The homeland is burned. The soul stands defeated,

app.lem: ni uueiz mit uuiu puaze: sàr verit si za uuize. –
app.rdg: Not knowing how to atone: but soon it will face punishment.

app.lem: pidiu ist demo manne guot, denne er ze mahale quimit,
app.rdg: Therefore it is good for a man, when he comes to the trial,

app.lem: daz er rahhôno uuelihha rehto arteile:
app.rdg: To have everything rightly judged.

app.lem: ni darf er sorgen, denne er ze deru suonu quimit.
app.rdg: Then he must not worry when he comes to the judgment.

app.lem: ni uueiz der uuênago man uuelihhan urteil er habet,
app.rdg: The deplorable man does not know what sentence awaits him

app.lem: denner mit den miatön marrit daz rehta,
app.rdg: When he hinders justice with bribery,

app.lem: daz der tiuval dâr pi kitarnit stentit.
app.rdg: That the he cloaked devil stands there:

app.lem: der hapêt in ruovu rahhôno uuelihha
app.rdg: He quietly takes into account

app.lem: daz der man èr enti sid upiles kifrumita,
app.rdg: every evil deed the man does, has done, and will do

app.lem: daz er iz allaz kisagêt denne er ze deru suonu quimit.
app.rdg: And he reports all this when he [the man] goes to judgement.

app.lem: ni scolta manno nohhein miatun intfàhan.- -
app.rdg: Therefore, a man should never accept bribes.

app.lem: So daz himilisca horn kihlutit uuirdit
app.rdg: When the heavenly horn is blown

app.lem: enti sih der suanari ana den sind arhevit,der da suannan scal toten enti lepenten
app.rdg: And the judge will raise himself up, who shall judge the dead and the living

app.lem: denne hevit sih mit imo herio meista,
app.rdg: And with him the army of the lord will rise

app.lem: daz ist alla sô paid imo man kipâgan ni mak.
app.rdg: Which is so brave that no one can outfight it.

app.lem: verit er ze deru mahalsteti deru dàr gimarchôt ist:
app.rdg: Then he will go to the judgement place, which is determined,

app.lem: dar uuirdit diu suona dia man dar io sagêta.
app.rdg: That is where the trial that we spoke of will take place.

app.lem: denne varant engilâ uper dio marhà,
app.rdg: Then Angels will travel over the homeland,

app.lem: uuecchant deotá uuíssant ze dinge.
app.rdg: Waking the dead and calling them to the thing

app.lem: seal manno gilih fona deru moltu arstên,
app.rdg: Then all men have to resurrect from the dust,

app.lem: ar dero lèuuo vazzôn: scal imo avar sin lip piqueman
app.rdg: Relieve themselves of the burden of the grave: he [everyone] shall regain his body,

app.lem: daz er sin relit alla kirahhôn muozzi
app.rdg: So that he can fairly explain himself

app.lem: enti imo after sinên tàtin arteilit uuerde.
app.rdg: And be judged for his deeds,

app.lem: denne der gisizzit der dâr suonnan scal
app.rdg: Then he sits, the one who tries in court

app.lem: enti arteillan seal töten enti quekkhèn,
app.rdg: and judges the dead and the living,

app.lem: denne stët dâr umpi engilo menigi,
app.rdg: With him sits the heavenly host,

app.lem: guotero gomôno garuuist sô mihhil,
app.rdg: and a great choir of good men:

app.lem: dara quirait ze rihtungu sô vilo dia dàr ar resti ûf arstènt
app.rdg: So many come to judgement who have arisen from their rest.

app.lem: sô dâr manno nohhein uuiht pimtdan ni mak.
app.rdg: There no one can hide anything,

app.lem: dàr seal hant sprehhan houpit sekkan,
app.rdg: Or else the hand will speak and the head will talk,

app.lem: altero lido uuelih ùnzi den luzigun vinger,
app.rdg: Every limb down to the smallest finger,

app.lem: uuaz er untar mannun mordes kifrumita.
app.rdg: What murder they committed for this man.

app.lem: dâr ni ist sô listic man, der dàr uuiht arliugan megi,
app.rdg: Therefore no man is cunning enough to be able to tell a lie there

app.lem: daz cr kitarne tàto dehheina,
niz al fora khuninge kichundit uuerde,
app.rdg: in order to disguise a deed,

app.lem: ûzzan er [iz mit alamuasnu furimegi
app.rdg: unless he has atoned for his sins (line 98)

app.lem: enti] mit fastûn dio virinâ kipuazti.
app.rdg: With almsgiving and fasting. (line 97)

app.lem: ni sorgé der gipuazzit hapêt, denner ze deru suonu quimit uuirdit denne furi kitragan daz frôno chrùci,
app.rdg: Therefore he, who has atoned, need not worry when he comes to judgement. Then the sacred cross is brought out,

app.lem: dàr der héligo Christ ana arhangan uuard,
app.rdg: Upon which the holy Christ was crucified,

app.lem: augit er dio mâsun dio er in menniski
app.rdg: And then he shows the scars that he received as a man,

app.lem: duruh desse maneunnes minna...
app.rdg: That he obtained through his love of mankind.
